name: Vamshi Kampalli

projects.name: Google - Flow Maker (At Google, Hyderabad)
projects.description: Flow maker is a web based tool tailored for flow developers needs, to create and maintain Speakeasy call flows in an expedite way while enforcing the established Speakeasy call flows standards without using Eclipse and Papyrus.
rolesAndResponsibilities: Understand Google's home built framework AngularDart, wherein Dart is a programming language.
Invest in research and development to build a top end web based editor which is accessible.
Achieve 90% code coverage along with unit tests for each block of the code.
Client interactions to have smooth and quality deliverables.
Leading a team through development and overseeing the process until deployment.

projects.name: Support Center
projects.description: A collection of web applications tailored for a leading IT corporation, aimed at enhancing the efficiency of delivering technical assistance to users and customers. Our efforts encompass both user/customer-facing applications and agent/resolver platforms, ensuring comprehensive support across the spectrum.
rolesAndResponsibilities: Analyze UX and product owner requirements comprehensively.
Develop reusable React components for diverse web applications.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define features and estimate efforts.
Leading a team in development, overseeing code reviews, and directing deployment processes.

projects.name: Goldman Sachs - Marcus (At Goldman Sachs, Helios business park, Bengaluru)
projects.description: Marcus by Goldman Sachs is a direct bank that offers personal loans and rewards savers with high-yield account options. I was part of the module onboarding customers for lending.
rolesAndResponsibilities: Done tasks like creating a mock server in node/express for the APIs to be triggered from the client side.
Develop the components or mold the existing ones as per the designed user story. Agile process, involved in all scrums and grooming for better understanding of stories.
Alone contributor from offshore regarding UI development, acted as POC for QA and deploying the application.

projects.name: Pearson - eText
projects.description: Pearson eText is a lightweight, digital replacement for a print textbook, provides a consumer grade, digital reading experience that takes advantage of digital capabilities to deliver content to learners than a traditional print text or a flat, pdf eBook.
rolesAndResponsibilities: Requirement understanding and analysis of the bottle necks, efforts, integration with other applications.
Develop React components that are reusable all through Pearson applications.
Work closely with fellow engineers from other teams to spec features and estimate effort.
Work with an agile/scrum team to deliver solutions on time and at high quality that conform to user story acceptance criteria.
Responsible for executing clean and progressively enhanced code for complex designs that reflect the architectural direction provided within the established technical framework.
Development and support for the production issues.
